item.title: Floating
item.dc:creator: @v0x v0x
item.description:
@v0x wrote:

Haha, i remember when i had this problem. Fairly simple man put this in your client.java

if(wearID == WINGSID){ playerSE = 1501; playerSEW = 1501; playerSER = 1501; playerSEA = 1501; }

If you want to see them rise up into the flying positon before being able to fly around(usually glitchy with wins)
use this:

if(wearID == WING ID){ setAnimation(1500); playerSE = 1501; playerSEW = 1501; playerSER = 1501; playerSEA = 1501; }

If you havenâ€™t figure it out already:

[code]

        playerSE = EMOTE ID;
        playerSEW = EMOTE ID;
        playerSER = EMOTE ID;
        playerSEA = EMOTE ID;[/code]

You can basically use alot of emotes and add them to other objects as well, although some might make you stationary (not able to walk around)

            setAnimation(1500);

That is the first animation that will start the other animations, think of it like a chain of events.

In that example, 1500 would do the mote of the character rising up, then after you click a space, your character would be suspended in mid air and be able to move around like that.

hope this helps.

Read full topic
